notes.title: NATO Enlargement: Sweden Joins (2024) & European Security
notes.content: Sweden's accession to NATO in March 2024 reshaped Northern European security and Russia–NATO dynamics. Typical exam angles: strategic implications for Baltic Sea, Arctic security, and deterrence posture.
keyTakeaways: NATO's northern flank strengthened; closer interoperability with Finland (joined 2023).
Signals sustained Western cohesion post-Ukraine invasion.
Implications for EU–NATO coordination and Russia's calculus.

resources.title: NATO — Sweden becomes NATO's 32nd member (Mar 7, 2024)

notes.title: Arms Control Erosion: New START & Broader Framework
notes.content: Russia suspended participation in New START (2023); U.S.–Russia data exchanges and inspections have broken down. Exam focus: risk of unconstrained nuclear competition and need for new verification regimes.
keyTakeaways: Verification/data-sharing mechanisms degraded.
Arms control architecture (INF, Open Skies) already weakened.
Policy debates on future strategic stability beyond New START.

resources.title: Arms Control Association — New START status & developments

notes.title: Indo-Pacific: Quad & AUKUS (Pillar II) Updates (2024–2025)
notes.content: Quad ministers highlighted maritime security and S. China Sea concerns (2024). AUKUS partners moved to consult with Japan on Pillar II tech cooperation. Exam focus: alliance networking vs. China, tech-security linkages.
keyTakeaways: Quad signaling on maritime law/order and cyber/undersea cables.
AUKUS Pillar II expands to advanced tech (AI, quantum, EW).
Potential inclusion of partners (Japan) on a project basis.

resources.title: U.S. State Dept — Quad Foreign Ministers' Joint Statement (Jul 29, 2024)
UK Government — AUKUS to consult with Japan on Pillar Two (Apr 2024)

notes.title: U.S.–China Tech Controls & China's Critical Mineral Responses
notes.content: U.S. tightened export controls on AI chips and tools (2024–2025). China escalated critical mineral restrictions (gallium/germanium). Exam focus: techno-geopolitics, supply-chain security, dual-use tech.
keyTakeaways: BIS rules broadened to laptops and advanced AI chips (Mar 2024).
China leveraged mineral controls impacting semiconductors/EVs.
Allies' alignment and compliance challenges continue.

resources.title: Reuters — U.S. updates export curbs on AI chips/tools to China (Mar 29, 2024)
USITC — Germanium & Gallium export controls (Jul 2023 background)

notes.title: Red Sea Crisis: Houthi Attacks & Global Trade (2024)
notes.content: Houthi attacks disrupted Suez traffic; U.S./UK strikes targeted capabilities in Yemen. Exam focus: chokepoints, freight costs, energy/security externalities.
keyTakeaways: Maritime risk shifted routes around Cape of Good Hope.
UNCTAD tracked significant drop in transits via Suez.
Escalation management ties to Gaza conflict dynamics.

resources.title: UNCTAD — Red Sea crisis trade impact (2024)
Reuters — U.S./UK strikes on Houthis (timeline/coverage 2024)

notes.title: WTO MC13 (Abu Dhabi, 2024): Outcomes & Sticking Points
notes.content: Members extended the e-commerce moratorium; partial progress on fisheries; agricultural talks stalled. Exam angle: multilateral trade governance amid fragmentation.
keyTakeaways: E-commerce moratorium extended after tough debate.
Limited advances on fisheries subsidies discipline.
Illustrates challenges of consensus-based WTO.

resources.title: WTO — MC13 Outcome Document/News

notes.title: BRICS Expansion (2024–2025): New Members & Partners
notes.content: Effective Jan 1, 2024: Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, UAE joined; Saudi Arabia considered; 2025 saw further partner/membership moves. Exam focus: multipolarity, Global South coordination.
keyTakeaways: Johannesburg II (Aug 2023) invited 6; Argentina opted out.
2024 brought four new members; broader partner tiers emerging.
Possible implications for finance, energy, and governance reform.

resources.title: South Africa DIRCO — BRICS Johannesburg II outcomes (Aug 24, 2023)
Council on Foreign Relations — BRICS backgrounder

notes.title: Pakistan General Election (Feb 2024): Outcome & Coalition
notes.content: Contested results, independents linked to PTI won most seats; subsequent coalition talks produced a government. Exam angle: electoral dynamics, governance legitimacy, policy continuity.
keyTakeaways: Fragmented mandate; coalition arithmetic shaped cabinet.
Economic stabilization and IMF program remained top priorities.
Security/civil-military relations as background variables.

resources.title: Dawn — 2024 election results & seat tallies

notes.title: IMF Programs (2023–2025): SBA Completion & New EFF Talks
notes.content: Pakistan completed the $3bn SBA (2023–24) and moved toward a new multi-year EFF in 2024–25. Exam angle: conditionality, fiscal/energy reforms, inflation/exchange rate management.
keyTakeaways: SBA stabilized short-term reserves and avoided default.
EFF sought deeper structural reforms and financing assurances.
Linked to tariff rationalization and SOE/power sector fixes.

resources.title: IMF — Pakistan SBA Press Releases (2023–2024)
Reuters — Pakistan/IMF financing assurances & EFF (Sept 26, 2024)

notes.title: Pakistan Power Sector: Tariff Hikes & Circular Debt (2024–2025)
notes.content: NEPRA notified base-tariff and FCA hikes in 2024; government rolled out circular-debt reduction steps in 2025. Exam angle: energy affordability, fiscal burden, CPEC IPPs, reform trade-offs.
keyTakeaways: Upward tariff adjustments tied to IMF benchmarks.
Fixed charges increased; affordability protests in 2024 summers.
Circular-debt resolution steps announced in 2025.

resources.title: Business Recorder — Power rate hikes notified (Jul 13, 2024)
Arab News — Circular debt resolution announcement (Sep 2025)

notes.title: FATF Status: Pakistan Off Grey List (Oct 2022) — Compliance Track
notes.content: Pakistan was removed from FATF grey list (Oct 2022) and worked to sustain compliance through 2023–2025. Exam angle: AML/CFT reforms, financial flows, reputational effects.
keyTakeaways: De-listing improved external financing sentiment.
Sustained enforcement and supervision remain critical.
Reforms interface with terror-financing and sanctions compliance.

resources.title: FATF — Pakistan removed from increased monitoring (Oct 2022)

notes.title: Kashmir: Article 370 Decision (Dec 2023) & Regional Implications
notes.content: India's Supreme Court upheld the 2019 abrogation of Article 370 (Dec 11, 2023). Exam angle: federalism, human rights debates, international responses, Pakistan's policy.
keyTakeaways: Reorganization of J&K affirmed by court.
International scrutiny persists; cross-LoC stability relatively fragile.
Diplomatic narratives diverge across stakeholders.

resources.title: BBC — India's top court upholds removal of Kashmir's special status (Dec 11, 2023)

notes.title: Indus Waters Treaty: Legal Tracks & 2025 Tensions
notes.content: World Bank advanced parallel processes (Neutral Expert & Court of Arbitration) on Kishenganga/Ratle (2023). PCA proceedings continued; India later moved to suspend IWT (2025 reports). Exam angle: treaty law, dispute resolution, water security.
keyTakeaways: WB facilitated two tracks in 2023 amid India–Pakistan disagreement.
PCA published orders/documents on CoA proceedings.
Water politics tied to climate variability and hydropower build-out.

resources.title: World Bank — Update on IWT dispute resolution (2023)
PCA — Indus Waters Kishenganga/Ratle (Case page/documents)
Reuters — India signals plan to suspend IWT (Apr 24, 2025)

notes.title: CPEC Phase-II & 2024 Diplomacy
notes.content: Pakistan and China elevated CPEC Phase-II with industrial/agri cooperation; 2024 leadership visit reaffirmed priorities. Exam angle: geo-economics, security of Chinese projects, debt/FX constraints.
keyTakeaways: Shift from energy/roads to SEZs, agriculture, IT.
Security of Chinese personnel remains a critical risk factor.
Debt reprofiling conversations continue.

resources.title: Pakistan MoFA — PM's 2024 China visit: Joint statement/briefings
Dawn — CPEC/China visit coverage (2024)

notes.title: Gaza War (2023–2025): UNSC 2728, ICJ/ICC, OIC Positions
notes.content: UNSC demanded immediate ceasefire for Ramadan (Res. 2728, Mar 25, 2024). ICJ ordered provisional measures (Jan 26, 2024) and later advisory opinion (Jul 19, 2024). ICC prosecutor sought arrest warrants (May 2024). OIC/Arab League held extraordinary summit (Nov 11, 2023). Exam focus: IHL, multilateral leverage, regional spillovers.
keyTakeaways: UNSC 2728 marked rare Council consensus (U.S. abstained).
ICJ & ICC actions intensified legal scrutiny of parties.
OIC/Arab positions called for ceasefire, aid, accountability.

resources.title: UN — UNSC Resolution 2728 (Mar 25, 2024)
ICJ — South Africa v. Israel: Provisional Measures (Jan 26, 2024) & Advisory Opinion (Jul 19, 2024)
ICC — Prosecutor's application for arrest warrants (May 2024)
OIC — Joint Arab–Islamic Summit (Riyadh, Nov 11, 2023) communiqués

notes.title: Nagorno-Karabakh (2023): Azerbaijani Operation & Exodus
notes.content: In Sept 2023, Azerbaijani offensive led to capitulation of Karabakh authorities; mass exodus of Armenians to Armenia. Exam angle: frozen conflicts, self-determination vs. territorial integrity.
keyTakeaways: Humanitarian displacement exceeded 100,000 within weeks.
Russia's CSTO role questioned; EU/U.S. mediation dynamics.
Precedent for post-conflict integration/rights guarantees.

resources.title: BBC — Nagorno-Karabakh exodus coverage (Sept 2023)

notes.title: AI Safety Governance: Bletchley (2023) → Seoul (2024)
notes.content: Global AI safety summits produced the Bletchley Declaration (Nov 2023) and Seoul statements/industry commitments (May 2024). Exam angle: norms for frontier-AI risks and dual-use concerns.
keyTakeaways: Bletchley Declaration set initial principles across many states.
Seoul Summit advanced company safety commitments.
Debate continues on model access, evals, and compute thresholds.

resources.title: UK Govt — Bletchley Declaration (Nov 2023)
Gov of Korea/UK — Seoul AI Safety Summit outputs (May 2024)
White House — U.S. AI Executive Order (Oct 30, 2023)

notes.title: COP28 (UAE, 2023) & COP29 (Baku, 2024): Climate Diplomacy
notes.content: COP28 delivered first-ever call to 'transition away from fossil fuels'; COP29 in Baku focused on climate finance architecture. Exam angle: energy transition politics, L&D fund, finance commitments.
keyTakeaways: COP28: historic (albeit non-binding) transition language.
COP29: negotiations on new collective quantified goal (NCQG).
Implications for Pakistan's adaptation finance needs.

resources.title: UNFCCC — COP28 Decisions/Global Stocktake
UNFCCC — COP29 Azerbaijan (overview & outcomes)

notes.title: Pakistan Heatwaves & Monsoon Impacts (2024–2025)
notes.content: Severe heatwaves (Sindh >50°C) and monsoon flooding episodes underscored Pakistan's vulnerability. Exam angle: adaptation policy, disaster governance, water/agri stress.
keyTakeaways: Early-season extreme heat strained power/water systems.
Urban flood risks persisted with intense monsoon bursts.
Links to agriculture yields and health outcomes.

resources.title: BBC — Pakistan heatwave coverage (2024)
NDMA/News — 2024 monsoon situation reports (Pakistan)

notes.title: UNSC Gaza Ceasefire (2728) & Multilateral Gridlock/Leverage
notes.content: UNSC adopted 2728 (Mar 2024) with U.S. abstention; demonstrated both rare convergence and ongoing limits. Exam angle: P5 dynamics, E-10 role, humanitarian access politics.
keyTakeaways: Resolution called for immediate ceasefire during Ramadan and hostage release.
Implementation contested; leverage via aid, pressure, mediation.
E-10 drafting highlighted middle-power diplomacy.

resources.title: UN Press — Adoption of UNSCR 2728

notes.title: SCO Summit Astana (2024): Security & Economic Tracks
notes.content: Astana Declaration (Jul 2024) advanced counter-terror programs (2025–27) and development strategy to 2035; Belarus gained membership status. Exam focus: SCO's evolving role vs. Western forums.
keyTakeaways: Counter-terror/drug strategies refreshed.
Talks on settlement mechanisms among members.
UN–SCO interface noted by UN Secretary-General.

resources.title: SCO — Astana Declaration (Jul 9–10, 2024)
UN — SG's remarks to SCO (Jul 4, 2024)

notes.title: Pakistan & UN Peacekeeping (2024–2025)
notes.content: Pakistan remained among leading troop contributors in 2024–2025. Exam angle: soft power, training, and casualty risks; budget politics of UN peacekeeping.
keyTakeaways: Pakistan's uniformed personnel >3,800 (Mar 2024 report).
Contributions span multiple missions (troops, police, staff).
Relevance to foreign policy identity and civil–military expertise.

resources.title: UN Peacekeeping — Country contributions (March 2024 PDF)

notes.title: U.S.–India Relations (2024–2025): Security & Trade Agendas
notes.content: Leaders set ambitious trade/tech goals (2025) and tightened maritime/security cooperation (Quad). Exam angle: implications for Pakistan and China, supply chains, defense co-production.
keyTakeaways: "Mission 500" target toward $500bn bilateral trade by 2030.
Focus on resilient supply chains and advanced tech cooperation.
Regional balancing vis-à-vis China.

resources.title: White House — U.S.–India Joint Leaders' Statement (Feb 13, 2025)

notes.title: Pakistan Inflation & Macro Stabilization (2024–2025)
notes.content: Inflation decelerated sharply into 2025 after peaking in 2023–24; stabilization hinged on IMF conditionality and fiscal/energy measures. Exam angle: inflation targeting, exchange rate, external financing.
keyTakeaways: Price pressures eased with tighter policy and base effects.
Tariff/pass-through and taxes still sensitive politically.
Growth–stability trade-off central to policymaking.

resources.title: Reuters — Pakistan CPI/inflation trend (2025 coverage)
